text.text:
I stayed at this supposed 4-star hotel (which essentially should be a 1-star hotel) with my family, including three members aged 60+, and three members aged 30+, for 3 nights and 4 days, mainly for New Year.

Here are detailed reasons why you should avoid this hotel:

1. The room provided for elderly people requires climbing stairs, causing severe discomfort for those with knee pain.
2. Most staff speak only English and Hindi, making it challenging for Tamil-speaking individuals to communicate.
3. Room toilets were poorly maintained, with broken seat covers and bad odor. Despite raising the issue, no action was taken until I had to shout.
4. The extra mattress provided was essentially a sofa, a poor choice for a 4-star hotel.
5. They charged approximately 20k for 6 adults on New Year's night, with organizers exclusively using Hindi and English, ignoring complaints from Tamil speakers.
6. Despite being a 4-star hotel, they had only one lift, and it was under maintenance during part of our stay. Staff and the manager were unhelpful, causing significant struggles for our elderly family members.
7. Room service and dine-in were frustrating as staff only spoke English and Hindi, often ignoring requests.
8. The hotel arranged a live kitchen in front of rooms without exhaust, causing more discomfort than the toilet odor.
9. The New Year party next to our rooms led to an entire night of frustration. We considered vacating the room at midnight due to our elderly parents.
10. When raising concerns about English and Hindi-speaking staff to the manager, he suggested that Hindi is our national language, refusing further discussion.
11. I booked a studio photoshoot, but it was later informed to be on B2 level, accessible only via stairs or the non-functional lift.
12. Requesting a campfire, I was misinformed about its location, and the manager suggested going to B2 level via stairs due to the non-functional lift.
13. The hotel lacks a "DO NOT DISTURB" sign, resulting in room service knocking even when guests are sleeping.
14. Room service changed blankets but left the old ones in the room, requiring an additional call for cleanup.

Conclusion:

Avoid this hotel if:
- You have elderly family members who cannot climb stairs.
- You cannot speak Hindi.
- You can't tolerate bad odors from poorly maintained toilets.
- You're unwilling to tolerate poor responses from the manager.
- You want to avoid a disastrous vacation experience.

text.text:
Recently dined at a bustling Hyderabadi biryani house in the city. The mutton biryani fell short of expectations, lacking the desired flavor. On the flip side, the chicken biryani stood out, offering a delightful blend of spices. The restaurant's lively atmosphere and appealing ambience added to the dining experience. Despite the disappointment with the mutton dish, the prompt service and the overall positive ambiance made the visit enjoyable. A mixed bag, but the flavorful chicken biryani and the lively setting redeemed the dining experience at this popular spot.
Alfaham is must try

text.text: We visited Hyderabad Biryani House after having read at Thomas Cook Travels that its number one ranked in Ooty of multi cuisine dishes. We ordered Mutton Kadahi, Chapati and chicken Biryani. All the spices are well proportionate with less chilli. Such a delicious Food is not seen in even 5 star hotels having travelled extensively in India UK and abroad. On to the top they provided is complimentary moctel and sitting at First floor which has excellent scenic view of Ooty Hill. Highly recommended this place for eating out in Ooty. Ashiq (Chef) Mohit, Suraj and Irshad deserves special appreciation with thanks.

text.text:
The location of the hotel is on a waterfront, which is 700m from Catherine waterfalls

The place has a lot of koi fishes which are entertaining to kids and adults. We can feed the fish using the food provided especially for the fish from the restaurant.

The view is a treat to the eyes, the outdoor seating is the added advantage

When it comes to food it has limited options
Lemon chicken was good but fried rice was not so great. Did not try other options.

They had goli soda which was good.

The service was superfast and very friendly.

Recommended for families with kids

text.text: The restaurant had a really nice vibe, and I'd say it's a must-visit spot. It's the kind of place where you can chill for a long time. The staff is friendly, but they could be a bit quicker – the service was good overall. The ambiance is great, making it a cool spot to hang out. I enjoyed my time there, even though the service could have been a bit faster. If you're looking for a place with a good feel and atmosphere, this restaurant is a solid choice. It's got a relaxed vibe, and the staff, while not super quick, are friendly. I'd recommend checking it out, especially if you're into a laid-back setting with good overall service. Happy customer 😊❄️

text.text:
I recently dined at Le Cafe in Ooty, Tamil Nadu and it was an extraordinary food experience.

It is an open air cafe in Ooty. It's a must visit place when you are in Ooty, you can chill for a lot of time sitting in the open.
The staff was friendly. Their service was a bit slow which they can improve. But it was worth waiting for good and yummy food.

We ordered pizza and fries which were amazing. The fries were super hot and crispy. The pizza was really tasty and full of toppings. These two items are a must recommended from my side.

The ambiance is great, making it a cool spot to hang out. Do visit 👍🏻

Food is overall tasty but repitetive at times.
Activities are mainly outdoor
provided weather is good.

Overall a good place to choose if you want to spend more time outdoors close to nature.

text.text:
Our stay at the Thalaserry hotel in Ooty left much to be desired. From the onset, we encountered significant delays in placing our food order, leading to a frustrating wait. This lapse in service set a disappointing tone for our experience.

Regrettably, the culinary aspect did not compensate for the initial inconvenience. The taste of the food fell short of expectations when compared to other establishments in the vicinity. The flavors lacked the finesse and quality we anticipated, leaving us dissatisfied with our dining experience.

In addition to the service and culinary disappointments, the ambiance and overall atmosphere of the restaurant failed to make a positive impression. It's disheartening when a visit to a hotel not only falls short of expectations but also fails to provide the basic elements of a satisfying dining experience.

In conclusion, our time at the Thalaserry hotel in Ooty was marred by prolonged waiting times, subpar food quality, and an overall lackluster ambiance. We sincerely hope that these issues are addressed, allowing future patrons to enjoy a more seamless and enjoyable visit.

text.text:
Visited the Thalassery restaurant for breakfast and had a rather disappointing experience. Most breakfast items on the menu were unavailable, including coffee.

Ordered putt and nadan chicken curry, paying ₹170 for curry that had only three very small chicken pieces, which was quite disappointing. The curry lacked thickness and seemed overly peppery.

Additionally, the Appam was not properly cooked. At the payment counter, we overheard other customers complaining about the chicken curry, and when we raised the issue, the staff seemed uninterested.

Despite the good ambiance, seating, and interior, the overall dining experience fell short of expectations.

text.text:
It was my 2nd trip to Sinclairs Ooty. This time  the experience is very poor. Their Standard is very low. I paid 8k for one night expecting the service will be the best like last time. The morning food quality was worst, all the guests were shouting at them. Every one was very disappointed. I will never book here.

They had a campfire at night for some groups they music was very loud that we couldnt hear our TV. In the morning there were broken glasses every were.

The whole building is not properly maintained. Lift floor tiles are broken.

I will say this was my worst stay

It was a Memorable stay so far.

This can be said as the best budget hotel in Ooty for friends, couples or families.

text.text: Nice place to have a peaceful stay on your vacation in Ooty. Parking might be a problem at times as the street is narrow(two way) and gets busy during rush hours. The lake side view was good. There was free WiFi and hot water available round the clock. Complimentary breakfast was good. No outdoor play area for kids but they have some indoor games arrangements. There was a bonfire and DJ party during New Year's eve until midnight. Overall we had a pleasant experience. Thank you.

text.text:
Visited this place during republic day long weekend. Rooms and location are great and a big plus for this hotel. Service is really pathetic. No hot water throughout the day. Suddenly water stops coming and spoil your entire travel plan. Coming to food, they have inhouse restaurant, but you need to wait half an hour for every order. Surprisingly, for curd rice too. Buffet breakfast is included for few, but the same menu everyday, you need to wait again 30 mins if the item is completed, for them to refill it. Someone scratched my car when it was parked, but the security person doesn't even know how it happened.

It's of worth only if you get some deal around 3k to 3.5k for a premium Lake view room. Else it's totally waste. Better to go for some premium resorts or hotels , atleast to get some professional service.

Totally, average stay experience here

Had a wonderful time at the hotel. Had come here with my dad. Taking long walks in the garden with dad was great. Also, the room was very clean and spacious with the wonderful 24/7 geyser. After dinner , enjoyed playing carrom with my father in the game room. The restaurant food was amazing with prompt and quick service.
To sum it up, I loved the hospitality of the staff , be it at the restaurant or the reception. One thing that I am sure of is next time when I come to Ooty, I would be staying at your resort for sure. It’s best recommended if you are coming with family here.

text.text: Loved our 3 night stay at Mayura Sudarshan, 2 nights in a wooden cottage and 1 night in their non ac suite in December. Wonderful property, beautiful landscape garden, which by itself is a major tourist attraction. Beautiful rooms, well maintained, clean with modern well fitted washeooms. The kitchen is well equipped, serving piping hot and fresh South Indian tasty breakfast. Very helpful and cooperative staff members of the hotel, from main desk to kitchen staff. A little further from the Ooty town centre, away from the chaos of main city but excellent location, not too far from Ooty Boat house and Rose Garden. Overall excellent stay and would love to visit again.

And to my surprise we found a little piece of feather in chicken curry which gave along with kal dosa. This is to the restaurant people, please please take care while you are cooking . So many kids are having food. So please take care.

text.text: It was a pleasant stay. Pretty good interior, lights and ambience satisfying our visit. Best quality of food, specially being a vegetarian, best food I had in Ooty so far. Building structure is little old, furniture also little old wooden style, but looks so traditional. Outside view from the hotel is adorable specially when you come in season. There is a lot of parking space, bigger common area, a large hall and spacious rooms. We got a welcome drink when arrived, staff was very polite and always on service, whenever we needed throughout the day. A remarkable 3 star hotel in budget.

text.text: I have travelled to quite few places and I can say Byke Sunshine Ooty was a Great accommodation I have stayed till date. The rooms are clean and tidy, each and every staff were friendly, polite and very accommodating. The food was exceptional. We enjoyed our stay there. Got to know that they have branches in few more places and if we ever go on a vacation to those places we will definitely choose them. Our only suggestion for them would be to install heaters in all the rooms as Ooty is a hill station and it gets very cold during winter.

text.text: The hotel had an antique touch. The architecture was like a mugal building. I could notice Taxidermy, the art of preserving, arranging, and displaying animal bodies so they can be hung on hunters' walls or set up in natural history museums. The heads of Deer and Bison were preserved and presented in this way. The hotel gives us a vintage feel. Let it be the construction, lighting and the facilities. But the food is not that vintage😂🤭It's fresh n nice. They've arranged a campfire for us, right infront of the Hotel itself. We not only enjoyed the campfire but also celebrated Christmas by cutting cakes. The night view from the Restaurant was super cool. The distant radiant dots were twinkling like gems.

editorialSummary.text: Warm rooms with tea plantation views in a rural resort featuring an amphitheatre & a skate park.

text.text: The overall experience is good, including food, hospitality, and room service. We took a cab from the resort, and the driver (Mr. Srinath) is a nice and humble person. He showed us all the spots without hesitation, and we enjoyed the trip.

originalText.text: The overall experience is good, including food, hospitality, and room service. We took a cab from the resort, and the driver (Mr. Srinath) is a nice and humble person. He showed us all the spots without hesitation, and we enjoyed the trip.

text.text:
I came here in December and enjoyed my stay.
The location is isolated in a beautiful Tea Plantation away from any sort of noise or traffic.
We woke up amidst mist and cold winds. The resort has small play areas for kids to enjoy in and also breakfast is placed outside when the weather permits.
We went on a small trek to a nearby hilltop and enjoyed our climb.
The food was tasty and was provided without delay.
Special thanks to Mrs. Divya and Mr. Anand who kept checking up with us in case we needed something and provided it to us quite quickly.
The location is pretty internal and we couldn’t go out for walks into the nearby city.
Please bring your own vehicle in case you want to travel because the only other means of transport is a cab which was a little expensive for us.

Ms Divya was handling the reception and guest relations. She was very courteous as well. Will recommend to anyone who loves nature and silence.....

text.text:
Pros- A beautiful location.Spacious and clean room.Some rooms have good views and some dont! But the resort has some beautiful views among the misty hills.A good room heater.A enjoyable mountain trek available right within.Some indoor activities( table tennis).A decent bonfire with some music.A few experienced and friendly staff, trying to accommodate everything you ask for.
The cons - A slightly steep road leading to the resort. Not so clean towels and mats! An outdated geyser in the bathroom making you wait 20 mins for water( when they are charging you a star hotels rate).An absolutely dull looking restaurant.Average food and average service in the restaurant.Very few experienced staff.Poor hygiene.
Enjoyed our stay because of the location and the few staff.

text.text:
Stayed here over the last weekend. I booked the royal suite. This stayed true to the amenities seen in the pictures. But the view from the room was a bit of disappointment. Only the rooms on the floor 1 will have the views you see online or on the pics. The 4 rows in the ground floor will not have the views as you see online. I did prefer the ones that had good views over the call, but i was told that all rooms have the same view which is not true. First floor will be preferred for folks who book longer stays.
Also note - the rest room for royal suite is on the front side of the room where you can hear people talking from outside as there is a store room next to the suite which I felt is bit of privacy concern.

Complimentary breakfast was okay, the cleanliness and the taste was average compared to my other resort stays. We did have dinner on the previous day - This was pretty good and was made on time.

Except for the views on one of sides facing the Kotagiri road, my family didn't find anything exceptional in the stay.

Overall - Recommended only for families that prefer indoors.

Note: There is some maintenance work going on and you can see dust / noises around it as well.
